ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Vocabulary and forms of Spanish tenses. My speaking and listening ability improved immensely as well.
Conjugation of more tenses (subjunctive, imperfect, future, commands). More speaking skills and engagement in culture.
I learned better conversation skills through this class, as well as how to deconstruct pieces of art and texts in Spanish.
I appreciate it how much work he put in to developing my Spanish and correcting my errors.
Greatly improved Spanish speaking and reading comprehension.
Spanish grammar, vocabulary, and cultural information

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Major assignments were well spaced out and professor was always helpful. Linguameetings were helpful and increased my confidence in my speaking skills. 
Weaknesses: Lots of work, grading can be a little harsh, exams usually had too much on them for the allotted time. I felt as if I learned a lot this semester but I'm not sure that my grade really reflects that (personally think language credits shouldn't be about letter grades). Moves relatively quickly.
Sometimes the work was redundant and not too helpful to building conversation skills.
Its strength is the seminar format.

Assignment length and difficulty was good
Linguameetings were helpful
Asynchronous days were good
Could use more listening comprehension practice e.g. videos without subtitles

This course was pretty fast-paced (faster than L1 if you took that during another semester) and the exams tested a lot of material at once that made studying for them or doing well on them slightly harder than L1. The course uses Linguameetings which was very helpful in forcing people to speak Spanish.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Despite the quickness, the course is a good language credit if you have taken L1 or have a decent grip on spanish.
Yes, I would definitely. Professor Russell is very understanding and encouraging of developing skills in Spanish.
Yes if you are looking to fulfill your language requirement.
